p: The Comoros archipelago (2144 Km2) consists of four volcanic islands that have emerged de novo from the South-Western Indian Ocean (SWIO) floor at the Comoros hot spot. They are distant of 40â€“60 Km from each other and are aligned on a Northwest to Southeast line, at the north end of the Mozambique Channel. The three northern islands constitute the Union of Comoros that ranks amongst the least developed countries in the world. The southern island of Mayotte is administered by France and exhibits significantly higher development indices.
